newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft rally intact.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Microsoft rally intact.

text.p: Microsoft Corp stock remained an investor favorite in U.S. pre-open trade Friday, the shares continuing to climb on last night's news of an 85 percent jump in fiscal third quarter profits, traders said.
Microsoft shares reached 105 before Friday's open, up 2-1/2 from the level hit in after-hours trade last night.
Microsoft ended Thursday's Nasdaq session at 98-1/8.
The software giant said it earned $0.79 per share in the third quarter, above the $0.64 per share First Call analysts' consensus forecast and the $0.44 per share earned one year ago.
Silicon Graphics Inc shares skidded 2-7/8 to 14-1/8 in early trade Friday, the sell-off inspired by the company's disappointing earnings report last night, traders said.

The company posted fiscal third quarter earnings of $0.09 per share, excluding one-time charges, down sharply from $0.31 per share in the year-ago quarter and below Wall Street's consensus estimate of $0.27 a share, according to First Call.
Quarterly earnings news also stirred early activity in Iomega Corp shares, which added 3/16 to 18.

The company said after Thursday's market close it netted $0.17 per share in the first quarter, up from $0.08 one year ago, and $0.04 better than the Wall Street consensus view compiled by Zack's Investment Research.

Other issues active before the opening bell included: IDEXX Laboratories Inc down to 10-3/4 from 12-1/16 after reporting earnings below expectations, Intel Corp up 2-3/4 to 140-3/8, Remedy Corp fell to 29 from 30-3/8, Andrew Corp rose to 25-1/2 from 23-1/2, and SDL Inc tumbled to 8-1/4 from 15-1/4.
SDL reported first quarter earnings last night of $0.04 per share versus $0.18 one year ago.
